utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So what brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, I'm so I have been coughing a lot over the past week or so. And it's been pretty dry, but I've been coughing like almost nonstop throughout the day, and I'm feeling very short of breath, and my bronchodilator helps, but I found I'm using it a lot now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how long have you know that you have asthma for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I was diagnosed when I was eight.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You're 10 now.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So you're using your bronchodilator more. This is the one that you use, kind of as needed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and then do you have one that you take every day no matter what?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? No, I don't have that one.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. You just have the one that you take is needed. Do you take any other medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no I don't take anything else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Just the one is it a it's a puffer?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you're using it more than normal, so how often were you normally using it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I was only using it like I don't know. Maybe once every two weeks or so. Not very often. But now I'm using it like almost everyday like five six times a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any are you? Does it usually turned out that you need it like during certain times like say when you're exercising or when it's cold?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I find I use it more, both like when it when it's right after I like, run around after gym during recess. Um and yeah, the cold also makes it worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any other triggers that you can think of?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no other triggers.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Normally get more in certain seasons?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I. I guess no, no big changes there. I find the cold air makes it worse like winter makes it worse or like. Yeah, maybe also the spring spring with like pollen and stuff like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you have allergies too?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think, so I haven't ever been like formally diagnosed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see I see. Yeah, that would make sense. No. OK, uh, so you say you've had more coughing lately, is that right? You said the last two weeks. Or the last week

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Last two weeks.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Last two weeks. Is your cough and a dry cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you been bringing up gunk OK. Dry cough? Have you noticed any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah, I've been wheezing a lot, actually.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh and that's uh. Do you use your bronchodilator every time that you're wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: When it gets really bad, like when I get so easy that I find it hard to breathe.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you're getting Wheezy even more times than then you're having to use your bronchodilator.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Are you having any symptoms at night time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, how they don't happen as much as my daytime symptoms, but I been having it maybe like every other day or like you know, every two days or so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And when you have these so when you have these episodes, you're copping your wheezy. Do you feel like you're having a hard time breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yep, that's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you feel it gets tight in your chest?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, have you had any any colds lately? Or any infections? .

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: K, does anyone that lives with you or anyone that you're around often, has anyone been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Could you have been in contact with anyone that sick even outside of your house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you traveled anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you lost any of your sense of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any any? Nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any belly pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: We just ask those questions because sometimes these things can happen with an infection or after an infection and we just want to make sure that that's not, you know what's happening right now. We probably will do a covid swab just because of the times that we're living in right now, but I just want to ask you a few more questions before I go talk to the doctor. So do you have besides your asthma, do you have any health problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no, no no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And you said, besides the bronchodilator, you're not taking any medications.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And you think you might have allergies in the spring? Do you have allergies to anything else that you know?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, does anyone else in your family have asthma?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think my sister has asthma too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Anyone in your family have any other breathing problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Anyone else in the family have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, sounds good and you live at home did you say live with your parents and your sister?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yep, that's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Cool. Are you currently going to school online or in person?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh both We do half days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How are you finding that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's been OK. It's it's different, but it's been working out OK so far.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Cool not to have to get out of your PJS some days.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, that's true.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, did do you guys have any pets in the home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No pets, we have just like well I guess we have goldfish.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, OK. Those are cool pets. Does anyone in the house smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, I think that's all my questions that I had for you today. What do you like to do for fun?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh I'm I like playing games online with my friends and and before covid we used to get together and have movie nights and play sports together.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It sounds really cool. Hopefully we can get this figured out for you so you don't have any, you don't have to use your your medications every time you play sports 'cause that's no fun. And

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You should be able to enjoy that. So, so we're going to try to get this sorted out for you. I'm gonna go talk to the doctor and tell him everything or her everything that you said and yeah we’ll come back and see you shortly, hopefully maybe all you need is a little change to your medications and maybe it will be better be able to better control your asthma.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds great. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Thanks talking with me and we'll see you soon.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
